abstract: Carl C. Icahn scored a major coup late Thursday when Motorola announced it may spin off its handset unit — what he calls a “long overdue” move. Now the shareholder activist seems intent on solidifying that progress by unveiling his own slate of directors on Friday. And in that list are some familiar, if unexpected, names.
lead_paragraph: Carl C. Icahn scored a major coup late Thursday when Motorola announced it may spin off its handset unit — what he calls a “long overdue” move. Now the shareholder activist seems intent on solidifying that progress by unveiling his own slate of directors on Friday. And in that list are some familiar, if unexpected, names.

headline.main: Icahn Announces Alternate Directors for Motorola
